intro: Pedicularis achilleifolia, commonly known as the creeping monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its spurred petals and tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, often in moist, shaded areas. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its stems are often prostrate or ascending. It produces small, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
